title: Second suspect arrested in downtown Vegas shooting that injured 4
content:
LAS VEGAS (FOX5) -
Las Vegas Metro police on Monday announced a second suspect has been taken into custody in connection to a shooting in downtown Las Vegas that injured four people.
Police said 20-year-old Steven Burks was taken into custody on Saturday without incident. He was booked into the Clark County Detention Center where he faces charges of attempted murder, batter, conspiracy to commit murder and discharging a firearm.
About 6:19 a.m. on May 29, police responded to reports of a shooting in the 200 block of North 3rd Street, near Ogden Street.
Officers located four victims - two men and two women – with apparent gunshot wounds. The victims were taken to University Medical Center. One of the men was listed in critical condition.
According to the Associated Press, two of the victims are from Australia.
An investigation indicated two men were having an argument on a sidewalk. As the victims passed by them, words were exchanged. The two men retrieved a gun from a parked car, and one of them fired on the victims. The men then got into their car and fired more rounds at the victims as they sped away.
Metro detectives on May 31 arrested 32-year-old Pierre Devlin in connection to the shooting. He was identified as the shooter.
